news_header: Terrafame, a state-owned company, faces weakened demand for electric vehicle materials, resulting in significant financial losses.
news_text: Terrafame manufactures materials for electric vehicles but has experienced weakened demand, particularly in Europe, due to slow electrification. The company reported a loss of EUR 14.3 million for July-September, an improvement from a EUR 20.3 million loss in the previous quarter. Despite these losses, Terrafame turned its operating margin positive in the latest quarter, after a negative margin of EUR 2.4 million in April-June. The company is implementing a development program aimed at achieving annual savings of EUR 10 million.
